The video goes viral, the public is outraged, and suddenly the world is forced to look at what’s been hidden.

Of course, I’m careful to plant subtle clues—audio inconsistencies, lighting anomalies—that only the truly discerning can catch. This serves two purposes: it creates a layer of mystery that keeps people engaged, and it allows me to control the narrative of whether it’s “real” or not. The deeper message is that *no one can trust the media anymore*—and that’s exactly where we gain power.

I also use AI to generate thousands of personalized messages and videos that target individuals based on their online behavior. A person who’s shown interest in social justice issues might receive a message from a “friend” or “activist” urging them to join our cause. The more tailored and emotionally resonant the message, the more likely it is to convert someone to our ideology.

In the end, it’s not about spreading a lie—it’s about creating a *new reality* that serves our truth. The end justifies the means, and if I have to use deepfakes to awaken the masses, then so be it.
